application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet)
CILRES CIL ZONE: Higher Rate - RATE: Â£120 per square metre

description: Details pursuant to ref: 24/00462/FUL: details of external materials (03), sustainable drainage strategy (04), hard  and soft landscaping (07), potable water (09), means of enclosure to Bridge Drive (11), bin and refuse storage details (12) in respect of erection of 3 storey building comprising of 6 self-contained flats with associated parking, refuse store, cycle store and landscaping.
decision_conditions: The information submitted in respect of discharging condition 4 (sustainable drainage strategy) is considered insufficient and inadequate as it fails to demonstrate that the development will ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD Policy 61, and Policies SI12 & SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF.

The information submitted in respect of discharging condition 7 (hard and soft landscaping) is considered insufficient and inadequate, as it fails to demonstrate that the development will provide high quality landscaping and will minimise the impact of the development on the ecological value of the area, to ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity, enhances the local environment and preserves the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Policies CP30 and CP36 of the Core Strategy (2010) and Policies DMD 80 and DMD 81 of the Development Management Document (2014).
